title: BMaaS — 00 Executive Fleet Overview
description: Multi-component fleet health score, node status, GPU-focused panels, power per entity, NVLink health, SLA targets, license tracking, GPU utilization, ECC errors, and RMA priority table.

panels.title: 🏥 Composite Fleet Score
panels.description:
WHY: Single number to assess fleet readiness at a glance.

FORMULA: Weighted average of 5 sub-scores:
  • Node Availability (30%): nodes_up / nodes_total
  • GPU Health (25%): nodes with gpu_health_overall == 0 / total
  • NVLink Health (15%): nodes with gpu_health_nvlink == 0 / total
  • GPU Utilization (15%): avg(gpu_utilization) / 100
  • ECC Clean Rate (15%): nodes with no DBE / total

Green ≥ 95% = fleet operational. Yellow 90-95% = degraded. Red < 90% = critical.
ACTION: Score < 90% → escalate to hardware team immediately.

panels.title: Node Availability
panels.description:
WHY: What % of nodes are UP and serving workloads.
FORMULA: nodes_up / nodes_total × 100.
SLA TARGET: ≥ 99.5%.
ACTION: < 99% → immediate investigation.

panels.title: GPU Health Score
panels.description:
WHY: % of nodes with ALL GPUs healthy (DCGM overall check = 0).
FORMULA: count(gpu_health_overall == 0) / count(gpu_health_overall) × 100.
SLA TARGET: ≥ 99.5%.
ACTION: < 95% → multiple nodes have GPU issues.

panels.title: NVLink Health Score
panels.description:
WHY: % of nodes with healthy NVLink (gpu_health_nvlink == 0).
NVLink enables 900GB/s GPU-to-GPU communication — critical for multi-GPU.
FORMULA: count(gpu_health_nvlink == 0) / count(gpu_health_nvlink) × 100.
ACTION: < 95% → NVLink cables or NVSwitch degradation.

panels.title: Fleet GPU Utilization
panels.description:
WHY: Revenue indicator — low util = wasted GPU capacity = lost revenue.
FORMULA: avg(gpu_utilization) across all nodes.
TARGET: > 70% healthy. < 40% = investigate scheduling.

panels.title: ECC Clean Rate
panels.description:
WHY: % of nodes with zero uncorrectable GPU memory errors (DBE).
FORMULA: count(gpu_ecc_dbe_agg == 0) / count(gpu_ecc_dbe_agg) × 100.
ACTION: < 100% → some nodes have uncorrectable errors → GPU replacement.

panels.title: Nodes UP
panels.description:
WHY: Nodes actively serving workloads = your available capacity.

METRIC: nodes_up — BCM nodes in operational UP state.
SIGNIFICANCE: This is the count of nodes that can accept jobs.

panels.title: Nodes DOWN
panels.description:
WHY: DOWN nodes = lost revenue + SLA risk. Needs immediate investigation.

METRIC: nodes_down — BCM nodes in DOWN state (not operational).
ACTION: > 0 = investigate hardware, cooling, network connectivity.

panels.title: Nodes Closed
panels.description:
WHY: CLOSED = intentionally taken offline by admin/BCM.

METRIC: nodes_closed — nodes in CLOSED state.
MEANING: 'Closed' in BCM means the node is reachable and managed but NOT accepting workloads. Typically used during maintenance, burn-in testing, or hardware validation. The node is between UP and DOWN — it's healthy enough to be managed but intentionally excluded from the scheduling pool.
NOTE: High count during burn-in cycles is normal. Sustained outside burn-in = investigate.

panels.title: Fleet Size (Total)
panels.description:
WHY: Total nodes in fleet — baseline for capacity calculations.

METRIC: nodes_total — total nodes managed by BCM.
CHECK: UP + DOWN + CLOSED should equal TOTAL.

panels.title: GPU Count per Entity
panels.description:
WHY: Validate hardware config — B200 DGX should have 8 GPUs per node.

METRIC: gpu_count — number of GPUs detected by DCGM per entity.
SIGNIFICANCE: < 8 = GPU not detected = hardware failure on that node.
ACTION: Any entity showing < 8 → check GPU seating, PCIe, DCGM logs.

panels.title: GPU Health Matrix (per Node)
panels.description:
WHY: Instantly see which DGX nodes have GPU health issues.

METRIC: gpu_health_overall — DCGM aggregate health check per entity.
0 = ALL PASS (green), > 0 = FAIL (red). Each row = one DGX node.
SIGNIFICANCE: Failed nodes should NOT receive new workloads.

panels.title: GPU Switches UP / DOWN
panels.description:
WHY: GPU switches (gp_us) are the NVSwitch ASICs on the DGX baseboard.

WHAT ARE THEY: Each DGX B200 has 4 NVSwitch chips that form the internal GPU-to-GPU NVLink mesh. They enable all-to-all GPU communication at 900GB/s. Without functional NVSwitches, GPUs cannot do multi-GPU collective operations (AllReduce, AllGather) which are essential for distributed training.

METRIC: gp_us_up / gp_us_down — GPU switches in UP vs DOWN state.
ACTION: gp_us_down > 0 → affected node's GPUs cannot communicate properly. Check NVSwitch, may need baseboard replacement.

panels.title: Managed Switches
panels.description:
WHY: Managed network switches connect DGX nodes to data center network fabric.

METRIC: managed_switches_up / managed_switches_down.
SIGNIFICANCE: DOWN switch = node(s) isolated from network → jobs fail.

panels.title: GPU Power per Entity
panels.description:
WHY: Track GPU power draw per DGX node. B200 = 8 × 1000W = 8kW max.

METRIC: gpu_power_usage — per-entity aggregate GPU power.
NOTE: Each entity name (e.g., skt-dgx0102) is shown individually.
SIGNIFICANCE: Sustained at TDP = healthy. Well below during load = throttling.

panels.title: CPU Power per Entity
panels.description:
WHY: CPU handles job orchestration, data loading, I/O.

METRIC: cpu_power_usage — per-entity CPU power.
NOTE: Typically 300-500W for dual-socket Grace CPUs.

panels.title: Combined Power (GPU+CPU) per Entity
panels.description:
WHY: Total power envelope per node — for capacity planning and billing.

FORMULA: gpu_power_usage + cpu_power_usage by entity.
SIGNIFICANCE: Each bar = one DGX node's total power draw.

panels.title: GPU NVLink Health (per Entity)
panels.description:
WHY: NVLink health per entity — 0 = all links healthy, > 0 = degraded.

METRIC: gpu_health_nvlink — DCGM NVLink health check.
SIGNIFICANCE: Unhealthy NVLink = reduced multi-GPU bandwidth.
ACTION: > 0 → check NVLink cables, NVSwitch on affected node.

panels.title: GPU NVLink CRC Data Errors
panels.description:
WHY: CRC errors = data integrity failures on NVLink interconnect.

METRIC: gpu_nvlink_crc_data_errors — cumulative CRC error count.
ACTION: Rising trend = cable/connector degrading. Reseat or replace NVLink cable.

panels.title: GPU NVLink Total Bandwidth
panels.description:
WHY: Verify NVLink fabric delivering expected throughput.

METRIC: gpu_nvlink_total_bandwidth — aggregate NVLink BW per entity.
EXPECTED: B200 NVLink ~900GB/s per GPU pair.

options.content:
## SLA Targets (Aspirational)

| Metric | Target | Breach |
|--------|--------|--------|
| **Node Uptime** | ≥ 99.5% | < 99% |
| **GPU Healthy** | ≥ 99.5% | < 95% |
| **NVLink Fabric** | ≥ 99% | < 95% |
| **Network Switches** | ≥ 99% | < 95% |

> **NOTE**: These are aspirational targets. Node uptime 99.5% is the primary contractual SLA.

## RMA Priority Scoring

| Signal | Score | Action |
|--------|-------|--------|
| `gpu_ecc_dbe_agg > 0` | **+100** | Immediate GPU replacement |
| `hardware_corrupted_memory > 0` | **+75** | DIMM replacement |
| `gpu_row_remap_failure == 1` | **+50** | GPU exchange |
| `gpu_uncorrectable_remapped_rows > 0` | **+25** | Schedule GPU swap |

## Escalation

- **P0** (DBE): → Eng Lead + Customer (immediate)
- **P1** (Row Remap/Thermal): → Hardware Team (4h SLA)
- **P2** (SBE trend/Throttle): → Monitoring Review (24h)

panels.title: Node Availability Trend
panels.description:
WHY: Track availability trend over time against SLA target.

FORMULA: nodes_up / nodes_total — fraction of fleet online.
SLA TARGET: ≥ 99.5%. Red line = breach threshold.
SIGNIFICANCE: Dips below 99.5% = SLA breach risk.

panels.title: NVIDIA License: Licensed vs Used
panels.description:
WHY: Track GPU license utilization — unused licenses = wasted spending.

METRICS:
  • nvidia_licensed_compute_resources — total licensed GPU resources
  • nvidia_used_gpu_resources — actually consumed GPU resources
SIGNIFICANCE: Gap = room for growth or waste.

panels.title: GPU Utilization (per Entity)
panels.description:
WHY: Per-node GPU utilization — which nodes are idle vs loaded.

METRIC: gpu_utilization — percentage of GPU compute used per entity.
TARGET: > 70% = healthy. < 40% = wasted GPU capacity.
ACTION: Consistently low on specific nodes = scheduling issue.

panels.title: Fleet Avg GPU Utilization (Trend)
panels.description:
WHY: Fleet-wide GPU utilization trend — is capacity being used efficiently?

FORMULA: avg(gpu_utilization) across all nodes.
SIGNIFICANCE: Trending down = workload migration or scheduling problem.

panels.title: Fleet GPU ECC Error Trend
panels.description:
WHY: Rising ECC errors across fleet = aging/degrading HBM memory.

METRIC: gpu_ecc_sbe_agg (correctable) vs gpu_ecc_dbe_agg (UNCORRECTABLE).
SBE rising = early warning of memory degradation.
DBE > 0 = IMMEDIATE GPU REPLACEMENT — data corruption occurred.

panels.title: GPU Health Failures Over Time
panels.description:
WHY: Count of nodes with GPU health issues trending over time.

FORMULA: count(gpu_health_overall > 0).
SIGNIFICANCE: Rising trend = fleet aging, environmental issue, or batch defect.

panels.title: Alert Level per Entity
panels.description:
WHY: BCM alert level per entity — identifies which specific nodes have alerts.

METRIC: alert_level — BCM's internal severity scoring per entity.
NOTE: This is a BCM-internal aggregate. Higher values = more/worse alerts on that node.
ACTION: Sort by highest to find the most problematic nodes.

panels.title: GPU RMA Priority Table
panels.description:
WHY: Proactively identify nodes needing hardware replacement.

SCORING:
  • gpu_ecc_dbe_agg > 0 = +100 (uncorrectable memory → IMMEDIATE)
  • hardware_corrupted_memory > 0 = +75 (bad DIMM)
  • gpu_row_remap_failure == 1 = +50 (HBM repair exhausted)
  • gpu_uncorrectable_remapped_rows > 0 = +25 (schedule swap)

Score ≥ 100 = emergency RMA. Score ≥ 50 = escalate. Score > 0 = schedule.

panels.title: Node State Distribution
panels.description:
WHY: Snapshot of all nodes and their current state.

METRICS: nodes_up, nodes_down, nodes_closed, nodes_total.
USE: Quick reference for fleet composition at this moment.
